title: Screenprinting screen letters
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805050706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ap_6302.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805050706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/qz_4761.jpg)
 I partly post this to see if anybody can take a crack at what typeface this is based on, most likely hand done. But I was wondering if anyone can give me some insight about these screens. I bought them in a junk shop, apparently they had been there a long time. The ink is still on them. At first I had guessed it was used by sign painters, but it seems impractical for individual letters to have a screen that big. Why would someone need a complete alphabet like this?

\*Note the % and ! as well as the extra s,t,e. They are about 4.5 feet wide and 2 feet tall. The letters are approximately 10 inches high. Thanks
author: scott_reinhard

comments.content: Good question. I bet you a pound to a bucket that this is a hand lettered set. Also there is no room to swing a squegee on these frames - barely room for a clean pull, if you know what I mean. Nice Q. Can't think of a practical application - I expect something will turn up.

One possibility, suggested by the extra S, T and E: someone was making movable letters for a sign board. I have a few sets of these, along with a nifty backlit sign. The letters are a gothic style (something like yours), and they're printed on heavy, white plastic cards. You make up the words letter by letter, sliding the cards into a slot on the front of the sign. I got the whole deal for a few bucks at a yard sale. It even included a box of dingbats, arrows and punctuation. Couldn't afford NOT to get it! (Now guests in my living room amuse themselves by making absurd messages.) Just one possibility.

Skylar

Thanks for the feedback. Skyfein, I thought about the moveable letters before also, and that makes the most sense to me. Now that I think about it more, the inclusion of the ! and the % but not any other glyphs seems important. Stores advertising sales and other events would definitely use 50% off, and SALE! Although there aren't any numbers. Makes the most sense though. Thanks.
